intro: Phyteuma betonicifolium, commonly known as the betonic-leaved phyteuma, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its tall, branched stems and clusters of blue to purple bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist meadows and woodland edges, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a distinctive hairy texture, while its flowers bloom in late summer. Phyteuma betonicifolium is valued in gardens for its ornamental appeal and ecological benefits to pollinators.
